metadata.Title: CVE-2020-23793 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in spice-server spice-server-0.14.0-6.el7_6.1.x86_64 of Redhat's VDI product. There is a security vulnerablility that can restart KVMvirtual machine without any authorization. It is not yet known if there will be other other effects.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-23793` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspice-server1 - 0.15.0-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> Issues that touch python_modules for spice in Xenial need to be addressed in spice-protocol.

criterions.comment: spice package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.15.0-2ubuntu4').
